[friendly-captcha-sdk](./friendly-captcha-sdk.md) &gt; [WidgetHandle](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.md)

## WidgetHandle class

This provides an API stub that provides the end-user JS API for a widget.

This class is only instantiated by the SDK - do not create a handle yourself.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class WidgetHandle 
```

## Constructors

|  Constructor | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [(constructor)(opts)](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle._constructor_.md) |  | Constructs a new instance of the <code>WidgetHandle</code> class |

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [id](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.id.md) | <code>readonly</code> | string | A random ID that uniquely identifies this widget in this session. |
|  [isDestroyed](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.isdestroyed.md) |  | boolean | When this is true the widget has been destroyed and can no longer be used. |
|  [sitekey?](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.sitekey.md) | <code>readonly</code> | string | _(Optional)_ The sitekey for this widget. It can not be changed after creation of the widget. |
|  [startMode](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.startmode.md) |  | [StartMode](./friendly-captcha-sdk.startmode.md) |  |

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [addEventListener(type, listener, options)](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.addeventlistener.md) |  | Shorthand for <code>this.getElement().addEventListener</code> (that is strictly typed in Typescript) |
|  [destroy()](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.destroy.md) |  | <p>Destroy the widget.</p><p>This removes the <code>element</code> that the widget was mounted to as well as the hidden <code>frc-captcha-response</code> form field.</p> |
|  [getElement()](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.getelement.md) |  | The HTML element that contains the widget. |
|  [getResponse()](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.getresponse.md) |  | The current response of the widget. This is the value that should be sent to the server and is embedded in HTML forms. |
|  [getState()](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.getstate.md) |  | The current state of the widget. |
|  [removeEventListener(type, listener, options)](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.removeeventlistener.md) |  | Shorthand for <code>this.getElement().removeEventListener</code> (that is strictly typed in Typescript) |
|  [reset(opts)](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.reset.md) |  | <p>Reset the widget, removing any progress.</p><p>Optional argument: an object with the name of the trigger that caused the reset. You would usually keep this empty. This is the <code>trigger</code> field in the <code>frc:widget.reset</code> event, which defaults to <code>root</code>.</p> |
|  [start()](./friendly-captcha-sdk.widgethandle.start.md) |  | Start the challenge. TODO: check what the current state is, in some states this probably shouldn't do anything. |
